> 

I actually tested that craft...it's nothing to fear.

First off, this craft has no missiles. No. Missiles. Only wimpy 50 cals.

Secondly, despite having bone-crushing acceleration, and the maneuverability of an A6M Zero, the AI flies the plane so wildly that it seriously reduces its ability to point itself in the right direction. My 40-ton fighter-bomber, with very obviously sluggish handling, won against this thing in a turning battle. Yes, my freaking 40-ton plane WON a turning battle against that craft.

Also, the countermeasures and wild flying make it very hard (but not impossible; I did record a few missile hits) to hit with missiles. This would be an advantage if it had weapons with greater range, like missiles. But with the low muzzle velocity of the 50 cals, and the very unstable flying, this thing rarely gets to shoot against other aircraft, let alone hit them.

Sorry sasquatch, but you need to make some improvements to that craft if you want it to do well.

Props to [@brianjwm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/156087-brianjwm/) for creating the bracket

**<u>Format Clarifications:</u>**

To win a match a craft must win 3 rounds against its opponent. To win a round, a craft must be the last under powered, controlled flight (the AI can hold altitude and manoever) and must be able to maintain this flight until the enemy's weapons pose no threat to it. If both craft are destroyed before either meet these criteria, both craft run out of ammunition, or fly out of range of each other, the round is a draw.

**TL;DR: Best of 5, last plane standing wins. If both planes get destroyed or run out of ammo, it's a draw**

Tomorrow I will post results and video
The Adder was more a test piece than a serious submission, but if no one else enters something real, feel free to have it killed in the first round.
